Common Utilities API¶

Shared helpers under common provide reusable logging, text canonicalisation, title resolution, and safe numerical operations used across the baselines.

Top-level orchestration helpers for the clean_data package.

This module stitches together the key pieces of the cleaning pipeline: loading raw CodeOcean or Hugging Face datasets, filtering unusable rows, converting interactions into prompt-ready examples, validating schema requirements, saving artifacts, and dispatching prompt statistics reports. It is the public surface that downstream tooling should import when they need to build or persist cleaned prompt datasets. All functionality here is distributed under the repository’s Apache 2.0 license; see LICENSE for details.

class common.TitleResolver(*, default_dirs=None, env=None, logger_name='title-index')[source]¶

Bases: object

Resolve YouTube ids to titles by scanning configured CSV sources.

Variables:

  • _default_dirs (List[str]) – Fallback directories searched for metadata CSV files.

  • _env_csv_var (str) – Environment variable that lists explicit CSV paths.

  • _env_dirs_var (str) – Environment variable enumerating directories to search.

  • _env_glob_var (str) – Environment variable providing glob patterns.

  • _index (Dict[str, str] | None) – Cached mapping of video ids to titles once loaded.

  • _logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance used for diagnostic output.

Parameters:

  • default_dirs (Sequence[str] | None)

  • env (TitleResolverEnvConfig | None)

  • logger_name (str)

__init__(*, default_dirs=None, env=None, logger_name='title-index')[source]¶

Create a new TitleResolver instance.

Parameters:

  • default_dirs (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional list of fallback directories searched for CSVs.

  • env (TitleResolverEnvConfig | None) – Environment-variable configuration used while discovering CSVs.

  • logger_name (str) – Logger name used for diagnostic output.

Return type:

None

common.add_comma_separated_argument(parser, *, flags, dest, help_text, default='')[source]¶

Register an argument that captures comma-separated values.

The helper keeps flag combinations consistent across CLIs that surface the

same semantics (e.g., study filters).

Parameters:

  • parser (argparse.ArgumentParser) – Value provided for parser.

  • flags (Sequence[str] | str) – Value provided for flags.

  • dest (str) – Value provided for dest.

  • help_text (str) – Value provided for help_text.

  • default (str) – Value provided for default.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None

common.get_logger(name, *, level=20)[source]¶

Return a memoised logger configured with a simple stream handler.

The helper mirrors the historical behaviour from the individual

baselines: create a logging.Logger, attach a stream handler

when none are registered yet, and set the level to INFO (or a

caller-provided override).

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Value provided for name.

  • level (int) – Value provided for level.

Returns:

Result produced by get_logger.

Return type:

logging.Logger

common.merge_ordered(cached, executed, *, order_key, on_replace=None)[source]¶

Merge cached and freshly executed results preserving order indices.

Parameters

cached:

Previously materialised results (e.g., metrics read from disk).

executed:

Newly computed results from the current run.

order_key:

Callable returning a deterministic integer position for each result.

on_replace:

Optional callback invoked when an executed item replaces a cached one

at the same index.

Parameters:

  • cached (Sequence[T]) – Value provided for cached.

  • executed (Sequence[T]) – Value provided for executed.

  • order_key (Callable[[T], int]) – Value provided for order_key.

  • on_replace (Callable[[T, T], None] | None) – Value provided for on_replace.

Returns:

Result produced by merge_ordered.

Return type:

List[T]

Top-level orchestration helpers for the clean_data package.

This module stitches together the key pieces of the cleaning pipeline: loading raw CodeOcean or Hugging Face datasets, filtering unusable rows, converting interactions into prompt-ready examples, validating schema requirements, saving artifacts, and dispatching prompt statistics reports. It is the public surface that downstream tooling should import when they need to build or persist cleaned prompt datasets. All functionality here is distributed under the repository’s Apache 2.0 license; see LICENSE for details.

This module stitches together the key pieces of the cleaning pipeline: loading raw CodeOcean or Hugging Face datasets, filtering unusable rows, converting interactions into prompt-ready examples, validating schema requirements, saving artifacts, and dispatching prompt statistics reports. It is the public surface that downstream tooling should import when they need to build or persist cleaned prompt datasets. All functionality here is distributed under the repository’s Apache 2.0 license; see LICENSE for details.

  • _model (SentenceTransformer | None) – Lazily initialised SentenceTransformer instance (None until used).

Parameters:

config (SentenceTransformerConfig)

Parameters:

config (SentenceTransformerConfig) – Behavioural options used when loading and invoking the model.

Return type:

None

embedding_dimension()[source]¶

Return the dimensionality of the produced embeddings.

Returns:

Number of features emitted by the underlying encoder.

Return type:

int

encode(texts)[source]¶

Encode a batch of texts into dense embeddings.

Parameters:

texts (Sequence[str]) – Sequence of documents to embed.

Returns:

Matrix of shape (len(texts), embedding_dimension).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

encode_iter(texts)[source]¶

Encode an iterable of texts by materialising it once.

Parameters:

texts (Iterable[str]) – Iterable of documents to embed.

Returns:

Matrix of embeddings corresponding to texts.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray
